episode_title: 119 - The One Where the Monkey Gets Away
note: {Transcriber’s Note: The credits list two characters, Tia and Samantha, who I assume are the sweaty women Joey and Chandler meet. However, I don’t know which is which, so I’ve simply called them Woman #1 and Woman #2.}

content.description: Central Perk, Rachel is talking to a customer.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, okay, I checked. We have: Earl Grey, English Breakfast, Cinnamon Stick, Camomile, Mint Medley, Blackberry, and.. oh, wait, there’s one more, um.. Lemon Soother. You’re not the guy that asked for the tea, are you? (Guy shakes his head) Okay.

content.description: Central Perk, Monica enters with some mail.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Mail call, Rachel Green, bunk seven.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Thank you. (Examines it) Oh, cool! Free sample of coffee!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh good! ’Cause where else would we get any?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh. Right. …Oh great.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What is it?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Country club newsletter. My mother sends me the engagement notices for ‘inspiration.’ Oh my God! Oh my God, it’s Barry and Mindy!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Barry who you almost…?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Barry who I almost.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: And Mindy, your maid of…?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Mindy, my maid of. Oh!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That’s Mindy? Wow, she is pretty. (Sees Rachel’s look) Lucky. To have had a friend like you.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Rachel and Ross are eating Chinese.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Marcel. Bring me the rice, c’mon. Bring me the rice, c’mon. Good boy. Good boy. C’mere, gimme the rice. (Marcel brings the rice) Thank you, good boy. Well, I see he’s finally mastered the difference between ‘bring me the’ and ‘pee in the’. (Rachel ignores him) ‘Bring me the’ and- Rach?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, I’m sorry. Oh, this is so stupid! I mean, I gave Barry up, right? I should be happy for them! I am, I’m happy for them.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Really.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No. Oh, oh, I guess it would be different if I were- with somebody.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Whoah, uh, what happened to, uh, ‘Forget relationships! I’m done with men!’ The whole, uh, penis embargo?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, I don’t know. I guess it’s not about no guys, it’s about the right guy, y’know? I mean, with Barry, it was safe and it was easy, but there was no heat. With Paolo, that’s all there was, was heat! And it was just this raw, animal, sexual…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Wait-wait. I, I got it. I was there.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, I mean, do you think you can ever have both? Y’know? Someone who’s like, who’s like your best friend, but then also can make your toes curl?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yes. Yes. Yes! Yes, I really do! In fact, it’s funny, very often, someone who you wouldn’t think could-could curl your toes, might just be the one who…
(Enter the other four)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: …Gets interrupted. Hi!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi, how was the movie?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Wonderful!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: So good!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Suck-fest.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Toootal chick-flick.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I-I’m sorry it wasn’t one of those movies with, like, y’know, guns and bombs and, like, buses going really fast…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, I don’t need violence to enjoy a movie. Just so long as there’s a little nudity.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: There was nudity!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I meant female nudity. Alright? I don’t need to see Lou Grant frolicking.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hugh! Hugh Grant!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Alright, I’ve gotta go. C’mon, Marcel! C’mon! We’re gonna go take a bath. Yes we are, aren’t we? Yes, we are.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: They’re still just friends, right?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: And I will see you tomorrow!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That’s right, you’re gonna spend tomorrow at Aunt Rachel’s, aren’t you.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, hang on, hang on. Does Aunt Monica get a say in this?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: ‘Pwease, Aunt Monica, pwease?’ Oh, unclench. You’re not even gonna be there.

content.description: Joe-G’s Pizza, the guys are there.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I can’t believe we are even having this discussion.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I agree. I’m, like, in disbelief.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I mean, don’t you think if things were gonna happen with Rachel, they would’ve happened already?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’m telling you, she said she’s looking for a relationship with someone exactly like me.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: She really said that?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, I added the ‘exactly like me’ part… But she said she’s looking for someone, and someone is gonna be there tonight.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: ‘Tonight’ tonight?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, I think it’s perfect. Y’know, it’s just gonna be the two of us, she spent all day taking care of my monkey…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I can’t remember the last time I got a girl to take care of my monkey.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Anyway, I figured after work I’d go pick up a bottle of wine, go over there and, uh, try to woo her.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey, y’know what you should do? You should take her back to the 1890’s, when that phrase was last used.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Rachel is taking care of Marcel and they are watching a soap opera.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Now, now the one in the feather boa, that’s Dr. Francis. Now, she used to be a man. Okay, now look, see, there’s Raven. We hate her. We’re glad she’s dying. Okay- (Marcel pushes down a cushion to reveal a shoe) Wh- wh- Marcel, are you playing with Monica’s shoes? You know you’re not supposed to pl- whoah. Marcel, did you poo in the shoe? (Takes the shoe into the kitchen) Marcel, bad monkey! Oh! Oh! (She notices the newsletter and taps the contents of the shoes onto it, then folds it shut) Sorry, Barry. Little engagement gift. I’m sure you didn’t register for that. (She leaves the apartment holding the newsletter at arm’s length. However, she leaves the door open. Marcel runs out in the opposite direction. There is a shot from the TV and Rachel runs back in) Who died? Who died? Roll him over! Oh, c’mon, roll him over! Oh…! Well, we know it wasn’t Dexter, right Marcel? Because- (Looks down and notices he is missing) Marcel? Marc- (Notices the open door)
[Time lapse. Now everyone but Ross and Phoebe is back at Monica and Rachel’s.]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: How could you lose him?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I don’t know. We were watching TV, and then he pooped in Monica’s shoe-

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Wait. He pooped in my shoe? Which one?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I don’t know. The left one.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Which ones ?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh. Oh, those little clunky Amish things you think go with everything.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: All
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Whoah, ooh, why is the air in here so negative?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Rachel lost Marcel.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh no, how?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: He- he pooped in my shoe.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Which one?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Those cute little black ones I wear all the time.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, which one ? The right or left? ’Cause the left one is lucky…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: C’mon, you guys, what’re we gonna do, what’re we gonna do?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Alright alright. You’re a monkey. You’re loose in the city. Where do you go?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, it’s his first time out, so he’s probably gonna wanna do some of the touristy things. I’ll go to Cats , you go to the Russian Tea Room .

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, my, God, c’mon, you guys! He’s gonna be home any minute! He’s gonna kill me!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, we’ll start with the building. You guys take the first and second floor, Phoebe and I’ll take third and fourth.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, what’m I gonna do? What’m I gonna do?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, you stay here, and just wait by the phone. Spray Lysol in my shoe, and wait for Ross to kill you.
(They all leave)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Anybody wanna trade? Oh…
[Cut to a hallway in the building, Monica and Phoebe are knocking on a door. Mr. Heckles emerges.]

content.speaker: Mr. Heckles
content.text: Whaddyou want?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Mr. Heckles, our friend lost a monkey. Have you seen it?

content.speaker: Mr. Heckles
content.text: I left a Belgian waffle out here, did you take it?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Why would you leave your Belgian waffle in the hall?

content.speaker: Mr. Heckles
content.text: I wasn’t ready for it.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: A monkey. Have you seen a monkey?

content.speaker: Mr. Heckles
content.text: Saw Regis Philbin once…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, thank you, Mr. Heckles. (They move off)

content.speaker: Mr. Heckles
content.text: You owe me a waffle.
[Cut to Monica and Rachel’s.]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, he’s a, he’s a black capuchian monkey with a white face… (Enter Ross) …with, with Russian dressing and, and pickles on the side. Okay. Thanks.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey. How did, uh, how’d it go today?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Great! It went great. Really great. Hey, is that wine?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah. You, uh, you want some?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, I would love some. But y’know what? Y’know what? Let’s not drink it here. I’m feeling kinda crazy. You wanna go to Newark?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uh, okay, yeah, we could do that, but before we head off to the murder capital of the North-East, I was, uh, kinda wanting to run something by you. Y’know how we were, uh, y’know, talking before about, uh, relationships and stuff? (Uncorks the wine) Well-

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh God, Ross, I cannot do this.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, quick and painful. (Starts to cork the wine)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh God… Okay. Alright. Alright. Okay. Ross, please don’t hate me.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, what? What-what?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Y’know Marcel?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: …Yeah?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, I kind of… I kind of lost him.
[Cut to outside the window, with Ross reacting with disbelief. The shot pans back until we see Marcel sitting on the window ledge.]

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, continued from earlier.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I- I- I ca- I can’t believe this. I mean, all I asked you to do was keep him in the apartment.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I know, I know, I’m sorry-

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, y’know what, I guess it’s partially my fault. Y’know, I shouldn’t’ve, uh, asked you to start off with a monkey. I should’ve started you off with like a pen or a pencil.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ross, I’m doing everything that I can, I’ve got everybody looking for him, and I- (Door buzzer goes and she runs to get it) Oh! Who is it?

content.speaker: Intercom
content.text: Animal Control.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: See? I’ve even called Animal Control!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You called Animal Control?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Uh-huh… why… do you not like them?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Marcel is an illegal exotic animal. I’m not allowed to have him in the city. If they find him, they’ll take him away from me.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: O-okay, now see, you never ever ever told us that…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That’s right, I.. ’cause I didn’t expect you were gonna invite them to the apartment!
(A knock on the door. Rachel swiftly opens it)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi, thanks for coming.

content.speaker: Luisa
content.text: Somebody called about a monkey?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, y’know what? That was a complete misunderstanding! (Ross puts his arms around her and they act all sweetness and light)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, we thought we had a monkey, but we-we didn’t.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Turned out it was a hat.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Cat!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Cat! What’m I saying? Cat!
(Luisa nods, but then Monica and Phoebe run in)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hi. We checked the third and fourth floor, no-one’s seen Marcel.

content.speaker: Luisa
content.text: Marcel?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: My uncle Marcel.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, is that who the monkey’s named after?

content.speaker: Luisa
content.text: Oookay. Are you aware that possession of an illegal exotic is, uh, punishable by up to two years in prison and confiscation of the animal?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh my God. You’d put that poor little creature in jail?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Pheebs, you remember how we talked about saying things quietly to yourself first?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yes, but there isn’t always time!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Look. I’m sure there’s some friendly way to reconcile this! Um, have a seat. First of all, we haven’t been introduced, I’m Monica Geller.

content.speaker: Luisa
content.text: Oh my God, you are! And you’re Rachel Green!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah!

content.speaker: Luisa
content.text: Luisa Gianetti! Lincoln High? I sat behind you guys in home room!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Luisa? Oh my God! Monica! It’s Luisa!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: The Luisa from home room!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yes!!

content.speaker: Luisa
content.text: You have no idea who I am, do you.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No, none at all.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: None.

content.speaker: Luisa
content.text: Well, maybe that’s because you spent four years ignoring me. I mean, would it have been so hard to say ’morning, Luisa’? Or ‘Nice overalls’?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, I’m- I’m so sorry!

content.speaker: Luisa
content.text: Ah, it’s not so much you, you were fat, you had your own problems. (To Rachel) But you? What a bitch !

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Be that as it may, d’you think you could just help us out here on that monkey thing? Y’know, just for old times’ sake? Go Bobcats?

content.speaker: Luisa
content.text: I could… but I won’t. If I find that monkey, he’s mine. (Leaves)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Dun-dun-duuuur! Sorry.
[Cut to another part of the building. We see Marcel jump in through a window and run down some stairs, then Chandler and Joey come down from the upper floor without noticing.]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Marcel?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Marcel?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Marcel?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Marcel?
(They come to a door and silently agree to try it. A very sweaty woman emerges)

content.speaker: Woman No. 1
content.text: Hi, can I help you?
(Chandler and Joey are dumbstruck for a moment)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Um, we’re kind of having an emergency and we-we were looking for something…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: A monkey.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes have you seen any?

content.speaker: Woman No. 1
content.text: No. No, haven’t seen a monkey. Do you know anything about fixing radiators?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Um, sure! Did you, uh, did you try turning the knob back the other way?

content.speaker: Woman No. 1
content.text: Of course.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh. Then, no.
(Another sweaty woman comes to the door and speaks to her friend)

content.speaker: Woman No. 2
content.text: Did I put too much rum in here?
(Joey and Chandler shoot each other glances)

content.speaker: Woman No. 1
content.text: Just a sec. (To Chandler and Joey) Hope you find your monkey. (She starts to shut the door)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, nononowaitwaitwaitnono! Uh… we may not know anything about radiators per se, but we do have a certain amount of expertise in the heating and cooling… mileu.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uh, aren’t we kind of in the middle of something here?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes, but these women are very hot, and they need our help! And they’re very hot.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: We can’t, alright? (To the women) We’re sorry. You have no idea how sorry, but… We promised we’d find this monkey. If you see him, he’s about yea high and answers to the name Marcel, so if we could get some pictures of you, you’d really be helping us out.
(The women quickly shut the door)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, from now on, you don’t get to talk to other people.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Marcel?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Marcel?!
[Cut to Monica and Phoebe searching the basement.]

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Marcel?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Marcel?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Marcel?

content.speaker: Both
content.text: Marcel?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh-my-God!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Whaaat!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Something just brushed up against my right leg!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What is it?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, it’s okay, it was just my left leg.
(Marcel makes a monkeyish noise. He is sitting in the corner)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Look, Phoebe!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah! Oh, c’mere, Marcel! Oh, Marcel, c’mere!
(Luisa appears on the stairs)

content.speaker: Luisa
content.text: Step aside, ladies! (She loads a gun)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What’re you gonna do?

content.speaker: Luisa
content.text: Just a small tranquiliser.
(In slow motion we see Phoebe look at Marcel, then at Luisa. She jumps toward Marcel just as Luisa fires the gun.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Run, Marcel, run! Run, Marcel! (Marcel runs off and Luisa runs after him. Monica goes to check up on Phoebe) Are you okay?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, think so. Oh! (She notices the tranquiliser dart has hit her in the butt and removes it) Huh. (Sways back) Whoah.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh gosh.

[Cut to Marcel walking along a hallway. He notices a banana on the floor and picks it up. The hand of an unseen person grabs him and carries him away. Then cut to Ross and Rachel on the street outside.]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Marcel?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Marcel?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Marc- oh, this is ridiculous! We’ve been all over the neighbourhood. He’s gone, he’s-he’s just gone.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ross, you don’t know that.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh come on. It’s cold, it’s dark, he doesn’t know the Village. (Kicks a sign in frustration) And now I have a broken foot. I have no monkey, and a broken foot! Thank you very much.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ross, I said I’m sorry like a million times. What do you want me to do? You want me to break my foot too? Okay, I’m gonna break my foot, right here. (Kicks the sign) Ow!! Oh! Oh my God, oh my God! There, are you happy now?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, yeah. Y’know, now that you kicked the sign, hey! I don’t miss Marcel any more!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Y’know, it is not like I did this on purpose.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, no no no. Nono, this is just vintage Rachel. I mean, things just sort of happen around you. I mean, you’re off in Rachel-land, doing your Rachel-thing, totally oblivious to people’s monkeys, or to people’s feelings…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ross.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I don’t even wanna hear it, you’re just…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ross.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, forget it, okay?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ross!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What? What?
(A man carrying a box of bananas walks past them. They stare for a minute and then hobble after him)

content.speaker: Both
content.text: Hey! Hey, Bananaman!
(Scene 4: Everyone in the hall outside Mr. Heckles’ door. Ross is carrying the box of bananas. He bangs on the door)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, this is so intense. One side of my butt is totally asleep, and the other side has no idea.
(Mr. Heckles opens the door)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hi, did you order some bananas?

content.speaker: Mr. Heckles
content.text: What about it?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Gimme back my monkey.

content.speaker: Mr. Heckles
content.text: I don’t have a monkey.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Then what’s with all the bananas?

content.speaker: Mr. Heckles
content.text: Potassium.
(There is a monkey-like noise from within and Ross pushes past Mr. Heckles and enters his apartment)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Marcel? Marcel? Okay, where is he? Where is he? Marcel? Marcel?
(Marcel jumps into view wearing a pink dress. Everybody gasps)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Marcel! What’ve you done to him?

content.speaker: Mr. Heckles
content.text: That’s my monkey. That’s Patti, Patti the monkey.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Are you insane? C’mere, Marcel, c’mon. (Marcel starts to go to him)

content.speaker: Mr. Heckles
content.text: C’mere, Patti. (Marcel turns round)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: C’mere, Marcel. (Turns to Ross)

content.speaker: Mr. Heckles
content.text: C’mere, Patti. (Turns to Mr. Heckles)

content.speaker: Luisa
content.text: Here, monkey. Here, monkey! Here, monkey! (Marcel runs to the door and into Luisa’s cage, which she slams shut) Gotcha.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, gimme my monkey back.

content.speaker: Mr. Heckles
content.text: That’s my monkey.

content.speaker: Luisa
content.text: You’re both gonna have to take this up with the judge.

content.speaker: Mr. Heckles
content.text: That’s not my monkey. Just the dress is mine, you can send that back whenever.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Alright, I want my monkey.

content.speaker: Luisa
content.text: No!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, c’mon, Luisa!

content.speaker: Luisa
content.text: Sorry, prom queen.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You had to be a bitch in high school, you couldn’t’ve been fat.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Alright. In high school I was the prom queen and I was the homecoming queen and the class president and you… were also there! But if you take this monkey, I will lose one of the most important people in my life. You can hate me if you want, but please do not punish him. C’mon, Luisa, you have a chance to be the bigger person here! Take it!

content.speaker: Luisa
content.text: Nope.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Alright. Well then how about I call your supervisor, and I tell her that you shot my friend in the ass with a dart?

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s. Rachel and Ross are there. Ross is trying to get the dress off Marcel.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: It’ll be nice to get this off finally, won’t it? Yes it will. (Marcel resists) Or we can leave it on for now, that’s fine.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Y’know, with the right pair of pumps, that would be a great little outfit.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Listen, I’m- I’m sorry I was so hard on you before, it’s just I…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, Ross, c’mon. It’s my fault, I almost lost your…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, but you were the one who got him back, y’know? You, you were great. …Hey, we uh, we still have that, uh, that bottle of wine. You in the mood for, uh, something grape?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: That’d be good.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Alright. (He goes to get the glasses. Then he hesitates and turns off the main light. Rachel looks round and he acts surprised) The, uh, the neighbours must be vacuuming. (He sits down and starts to pour the wine) Well, so long as we’re here and, uh, not on the subject, I was thinking about, uh, how mad we got at each other before, and, um, I was thinking maybe it was partially because of how we, um…
(Barry bursts in)

content.speaker: Barry
content.text: Rachel.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Barry?!

content.speaker: Barry
content.text: I can’t. I can’t do it, I can’t marry Mindy. I think I’m still in love with you.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: We have got to start locking that door!

content.description: Central Perk, Monica, Joey, Phoebe, and Chandler are looking through Monica’s high school yearbook

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: This is me in The Sound of Music . See the von Trapp kids?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Nope.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That’s because I’m in front of them.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Eh. I thought that was an alp.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, high school was not my favourite time.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I dunno, I loved high school. Y’know? It was just four years of parties and dating and sex.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, well I went to boarding school with four hundred boys. Any sex I had would’ve involved a major lifestyle choice.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Gosh, doesn’t it seem like a million years ago?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh. Oooh! Ooh! Ooh! (She stands up and starts to dance around) Ooh! My butt cheek is waking up! Oooh! Ooh!
